verses.text: 窮人的呼喊那時，民眾和他們的妻子大聲呼冤，控告自己的同胞猶大人。

words.note: Refers to the people from Judah or Jews.

verses.text: 有些人說：「我們和兒女人口眾多，給我們五穀餬口，可以存活。」

words.note: Here means 'number of people in a household'.
Refers to the five main grains of ancient China, or generally 'all grains'.
Lit. 'to make gruel for the mouth', meaning barely subsist.

verses.text: 有些人說：「我們抵押了自己的田地、葡萄園和房屋，為要在饑荒中買到五穀。」

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of
words.note: A more formal or archaic way to express 'in order to'.

words.definition: manage to buy, acquire by buying
words.note: Indicates successful completion of buying.

verses.text: 有些人說：「我們為了要借錢向王納稅，只好抵押了我們的田地和葡萄園。

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of

verses.text: 雖然我們的身體與我們同胞的身體一樣，我們的兒女與他們的兒女也相同，可是我們卻要強迫自己的兒女去作僕婢，而且我們的女兒有些已經作了奴婢，我們卻無能為力，因為我們的田地和葡萄園已經屬於別人了。」

words.note: More formal than 和.
Refers collectively to male and female bondservants or slaves.
Specifically refers to female bondservants or slaves.
An idiom meaning 'to be unable to do anything'.

verses.text: 尼希米怒斥官長與領袖我聽見他們的哀叫和所講的這些事，就十分忿怒。

words.note: Used to nominalize a verb or verb phrase.
Lit. 'ten parts,' meaning 'to a high degree.'

verses.text: 我心中籌算一番以後，就譴責貴族和官長，對他們說：「你們各人向自己的同胞貸款，竟然索取高利！」於是我召開大會攻擊他們。

words.note: Indicates a round of action or a period of time.
Lit. 'from the same womb,' implying shared origin/heritage.

verses.text: 我對他們說：「我們已盡了我們的能力，把那些賣了給外族人的同胞猶大人買贖回來，而你們還想要出賣你們的同胞，好讓我們再把他們買回來嗎？」他們都默不作聲，無話可說。

words.note: Marks the object of a verb when it precedes the verb.
Commonly used in Bible to refer to non-Israelites.
An idiom meaning 'not utter a sound.'
An idiom meaning 'have nothing to say.'

verses.text: 我又說：「你們這事作得不對。你們豈不應懷著敬畏我們 神的心行事為人，免遭我們的仇敵外族人的毀謗嗎？

words.note: Used to describe the manner or result of an action.
Used to form a rhetorical question, implying the opposite.
Often used in religious contexts for reverential fear.
An idiom meaning 'to conduct one's affairs and interact with people.'
Commonly used in Bible to refer to non-Israelites.

verses.text: 現在我和我的兄弟，以及我的僕人要把銀錢和五穀借給他們。讓我們大家都放棄放債取利吧！

words.note: Refers to the five main grains of ancient China, or generally grain.
Lit. 'big family,' meaning everyone.

verses.text: 請你們今天就把他們的田地、葡萄園、橄欖園、房屋，以及你們向他們索取的利息：百分之一的利錢、五穀、新酒和新油，都歸還給他們。」

words.note: Refers to a place where olive trees are cultivated.
Refers to staple grains. Implies general agricultural produce.
Often represents fresh produce or blessings in biblical contexts.
Usually olive oil, symbolizing blessings or anointing in the Bible.

verses.text: 他們就說：「我們必定歸還，不再向他們要求利息了，你怎麼說，我們願意照著你說的去行。」我就把祭司們召了來，叫眾人起誓必照著這話去行。

words.note: A person who performs religious rites and sacrifices.
Implies calling someone to oneself.
To make a solemn declaration, often invoking a divine being.

verses.text: 我抖著胸前的衣襟說：「不履行這話的，願 神也是這樣抖他離開他的家和產業，直到抖空。」全體會眾都說：「阿們！」又讚美耶和華。眾人都照著這話去行。

words.note: Refers to the front part of a garment, traditionally used for holding things or in symbolic gestures.
Refers to the one true God in monotheistic religions.
A vivid image of complete divestment or emptying out.
A gathering of people, especially for religious purposes.
A Hebrew affirmation meaning 'so be it' or 'truly'.
To express adoration, especially towards God.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 尼希米清廉樸實自從我奉命在猶大地作他們省長的日子以來，就是從亞達薛西王二十年，直到三十二年，共十二年，我和我的兄弟都沒有吃過省長的俸祿。

words.note: Often implies receiving a command from a higher authority, e.g., king or God.
A provincial administrator, a high-ranking official.
Artaxerxes I, a king of the Achaemenid Empire.
Refers to income or stipend for holding an official position.

verses.text: 在我們以先的前任省長，重壓人民，每日都向他們索取糧食和酒，以及四百五十六克銀子。連他們的僕人也轄制人民，但我因為敬畏 神，就不這樣行。

words.note: To burden or oppress severely.
Refers to a person who serves another, often in a position of subservience.
To govern or control, often with an implication of oppressive rule.
A deep reverence and respectful fear, especially towards God.

verses.text: 我堅持只重修城牆的工程；所以我們不購置田產，我所有的僕人也都聚集在那裡工作。

words.note: Common in biblical contexts for 'servant of God' or 'servant of a master'.

verses.text: 在我桌上吃飯的，有一百五十個猶大人和官長，還有那些從我們四圍外族來到我們這裡的人；

words.note: Indicates 'those who eat'
Refers to high-ranking officials in ancient contexts.
Often used in biblical texts for non-Israelite nations.
Indicates 'those people who come'

verses.text: 每天預備牛一頭、肥羊六隻，又為我預備一些飛禽；每十天供應大量各類的酒。雖然這樣，我仍然沒有索取省長的俸祿，因為這些人服役已經負擔沉重。

words.note: Often refers to sheep raised for sacrifice or special meals in ancient times.
Refers to official salary or emoluments, often in ancient/religious texts.
Often implies military or public service in ancient times.

verses.text: 「我的 神啊，求你記念我，記念我為這人民所作的一切事，施恩給我。」

words.note: A respectful way to refer to the singular God, often with a preceding space.
Used at the end of a sentence to express emotion (e.g., surprise, admiration).
Often used in prayer to ask God to remember actions or people.
Often used in prayer to ask God to remember actions or people.
A classical construction indicating the passive or completed action.
To grant divine favor or mercy.
